ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the class to someone who is looking for a science credit without wanting a very intensive class.

A survey course that meets once a week on different fields of science, taught by guest lecturers who are experts in their fields. Very interesting, not high commitment, definitely worth taking for those who want a broad introduction to different fields of science, and don't mind having class on Friday afternoons!
I would only recommend the course to humanities or social science students who have an interest in the natural sciences but don't know enough about them to pursue further studies.

I would definitely recommend SCIE 030. It is not a demanding course but highly informative. I think it's intended for non-science majors but as a science major, I still found the material new and at times, challenging. The small class size facilitates discussion and allows students to easily ask questions.
